Handel's Messiah, an English-language oratorio composed in 1741, addresses the birth of a child, who, according to the gospels of Luke and Matthew, was born in Bethlehem, primarily in **Part I** of the work.[1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Messiah_Part_I), [2](https://study.com/academy/lesson/handels-messiah-history-music-analysis.html), [3](https://www.smithsonianmag.com/arts-culture/the-glorious-history-of-handels-messiah-148168540/), [4](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Messiah_(Handel))

Key elements within Part I that cover this event include:
*   The chorus "For unto us a child is born" (No. 12), which anticipates the birth of the Messiah.[5](https://medium.com/atlanta-symphony-orchestra/ten-things-you-might-not-know-about-handels-messiah-56ce88bf710d), [6](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TN5BaOGTmGs), [7](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y9niXCM681g), [8](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2UGKEWJoFCc)
*   The "Pifa" (No. 13), an instrumental pastorale, which introduces the shepherds in Bethlehem.[1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Messiah_Part_I), [9](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Structure_of_Handel%27s_Messiah)
*   The scene depicting the annunciation to the shepherds (Nos. 14-17), which is directly taken from the Gospel of Luke (Luke 2:14).[1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Messiah_Part_I), [4](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Messiah_(Handel)), [9](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Structure_of_Handel%27s_Messiah) This scene describes angels telling a group of shepherds about the birth of Jesus.[1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Messiah_Part_I)

Part I of Messiah is often referred to as the "Christmas" portion due to its focus on the prophecy and birth of Christ.[1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Messiah_Part_I), [3](https://www.smithsonianmag.com/arts-culture/the-glorious-history-of-handels-messiah-148168540/) The libretto, compiled by Charles Jennens, draws extensively from biblical texts, including the Old Testament prophets and the Gospels, to narrate and reflect upon the coming of the Messiah.[5](https://medium.com/atlanta-symphony-orchestra/ten-things-you-might-not-know-about-handels-messiah-56ce88bf710d), [4](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Messiah_(Handel)), [10](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-f4TY_nH-Pc), [11](https://cbn.com/news/world/true-story-behind-handels-messiah-and-day-he-had-vision-god-heaven)
